    • Method Detail

      • getNodeCount

        public int getNodeCount()
        Get the number of nodes.
        Returns:
        the number of resources

      • setNodeCount

        public void setNodeCount(int resourceCount)
        Set the number of resources, which is the total number of resources where the number of processes should be distributed on.
        Parameters:
        resourceCount - the number of resources

      • getProcessesPerNode

        public int getProcessesPerNode()
        Get the number of processes started on each node. The total number of processes started is getProcessesPerNode() * getNodeCount()
        Returns:
        the number of processes

      • setProcessesPerNode

        public void setProcessesPerNode(int ppn)
        Get the number of processes started on each node.
        Parameters:
        ppn - the number of processes

        public int getMaxTime()

      • setMaxTime

        public void setMaxTime(int maxTime)

      • getExecutable

        public String getExecutable()
        Returns the path to the executable. For the following commandline "/bin/cat hello world > out" it will return a String "/bin/cat".
        Returns:
        the path to the executable.

      • setExecutable

        public void setExecutable(String executable)
        Sets the path to the executable. For the following commandline "/bin/cat hello world > out" the String "/bin/cat" should be provided.
        Parameters:
        executable - The path to the executable.

      • getArguments

        public List<String> getArguments()
        Returns the arguments of the executable. For the following commandline "/bin/cat hello world > out" it will return a String []{"hello", "world", ">", "out"}
        Returns:
        Returns the commandline arguments.

      • setArguments

        public void setArguments(String... arguments)
        Sets the arguments of the executable. For the following commandline "/bin/cat hello world" the String[]{"hello", "world"} contains the arguments.
        Parameters:
        arguments - The commandline arguments to set.

      • getEnvironment

        public Map<String,String> getEnvironment()
        Returns the environment of the executable. The environment of the executable consists of a Map of environment variables with their values (for instance the key, value pair "JAVA_HOME", "/path/to/java").
        Returns:
        the environment

      • setEnvironment

        public void setEnvironment(Map<String,String> environment)
        Sets the environment of the executable. The environment of the executable consists of a Map of environment variables with their values (for instance the key, value pair "JAVA_HOME", "/path/to/java").
        Parameters:
        environment - The environment to set.

      • getStdout

        public Path getStdout()
        Returns the stdout Path.
        Returns:
        the stdout Path.

      • setStdout

        public void setStdout(Path stdout)
        Sets the stdout Path. Note that stdout will be redirected to either a Path or a OutputStream. The last invocation of setStdout() determines whether the destination of the output.
        Parameters:
        stdout - The Path where stdout is redirected to.

      • getStderr

        public Path getStderr()
        Returns the stderr Path.
        Returns:
        the stderr Path

      • setStderr

        public void setStderr(Path stderr)
        Sets the stderr Path. Note that stderr will be redirected to either a Path or a OutputStream. The last invocation of setStderr() determines whether the destination of the output.
        Parameters:
        stderr - The Path where stderr is redirected to.

      • getPreStagedFiles

        public Map<Path,Path> getPreStagedFiles()
        Returns the pre staged file set. This a Map with the source Paths as keys and the destination Paths as values. This method returns the files that should be pre staged regardless of whether they are already pre staged or not.
        Returns:
        the pre staged file set.

      • setPreStagedFiles

        public void setPreStagedFiles(Path... files)
        Sets the pre staged file set. Any former pre staged files added to the pre staged file set are no longer part of the pre staged file set. More Paths can be added using the addPreStagedPath methods. See these methods for a table stating at which locations the Paths will end up after the pre staging.
        Parameters:
        files - An array of files that should be pre staged.

      • addPreStagedFile

        public void addPreStagedFile(Path src)
        Add a single pre stage file. This is similar to addPreStagedPath(src, null).
        Parameters:
        src - the file that should be pre staged.

      • addPreStagedFile

        public void addPreStagedFile(Path src,
                    Path dest)
        Add a single pre stage file that should be pre staged to the given destination. The table below shows where the pre stage files will end up after pre staging.

        where do the pre staged files end up
        source file destination file location after pre staging
        path/to/file null sandbox/file
        path/to/file other/path/to/file sandbox/other/path/to/file
        path/to/file /other/path/to/file /other/path/to/file
        /path/to/file null sandbox/file
        /path/to/file other/path/to/file sandbox/other/path/to/file
        /path/to/file /other/path/to/file /other/path/to/file
        Parameters:
        src - the Path that should be pre staged (may not be null)
        dest - the Path that should exist after the pre staging (may be null, see table).

      • getPostStagedFiles

        public Map<Path,Path> getPostStagedFiles()
        Returns the post stage file set. The key Paths are the source files on the execution site, the values are the Paths with the destination of the post staging. This method returns the files that should be post staged regardless of whether they are already post staged or not.
        Returns:
        the post stage file set

      • setPostStagedFiles

        public void setPostStagedFiles(Path... files)
        Sets the post staged file set. Any former post staged files added to the post staged file set are no longer part of the post staged file set. More Paths can be added using the addPostStagedPath methods. See these methods for a table stating at which locations the Paths will end up after the post staging.
        Parameters:
        files - An array of files that should be pre staged.

      • addPostStagedFiles

        public void addPostStagedFiles(Path src)
        Add a single post stage file. This is similar to addPostStagedPath(src, null).
        Parameters:
        src - the file that should be post staged.

      • addPostStagedFiles

        public void addPostStagedFiles(Path src,
                      Path dest)
        Add a single post stage file that should be post staged to the given destination. The table below shows where the post stage files will end up after post staging.

        where do the post staged files end up
        source file destination file location after post staging
        path/to/file null cwd/file
        path/to/file other/path/to/file cwd/other/path/to/file
        path/to/file /other/path/to/file /other/path/to/file
        /path/to/file null cwd/file
        /path/to/file other/path/to/file cwd/other/path/to/file
        /path/to/file /other/path/to/file /other/path/to/file
        Parameters:
        src - the Path that should be post staged (may not be null)
        dest - the Path that should exist after the post staging (may be null, see table).

      • deleteSandbox

        public boolean deleteSandbox()

      • setDeleteSandbox

        public void setDeleteSandbox(boolean deleteSandbox)

      • wipeSandbox

        public boolean wipeSandbox()

      • setWipeSandbox

        public void setWipeSandbox(boolean wipeSandbox)
        Sets the wipe sandbox flag. If set, the sandbox will be overwritten before being deleted, to make sure no data remains on the harddrive. Useful for privacy sensitive data. Implies deleteSandbox() == true

      • offlineMode

        public boolean offlineMode()

      • setOfflineMode

        public void setOfflineMode(boolean offlineMode)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
